div.p: I did not dare to send nothing in the way of letters to you as Fabricius was setting out to you.

What more is there that an eloquent man would not have expressed more clearly in this my letter? Certainly, my constant and singular love towards you... I have communicated some things to such a certain man, which I would scarcely have entrusted to a letter. If you have discovered anything deeper, which may be to your advantage, I would love for you to inform me.
I am eager to know what you hear about the Palatine.
